# Task

Write a function `ispersonal` that returns a trait if the provided Vehicle type is a personal vehicle for everyday driving. All vehicles are subtypes of AbstractVehicle. Function must work for types: Car, Motorcycle, Bus, Truck. The first two should return true, the latter two should return false . The function should default to false for any other subtype of AbstractVehicle. Provide an example.



# Special Instructions

{{instructions}}

# Solution

```julia
abstract type AbstractVehicle end
struct Car <: AbstractVehicle end
struct Motorcycle <: AbstractVehicle end
struct Bus <: AbstractVehicle end
struct Truck <: AbstractVehicle end

function ispersonal(vehicle::AbstractVehicle)
    if typeof(vehicle) == Car || typeof(vehicle) == Motorcycle
        return true
    else
        return false
    end
end

# Example usage:
julia> ispersonal(Car())
true

julia> ispersonal(Motorcycle())
true

julia> ispersonal(Bus())
false

julia> ispersonal(Truck())
false
```

# Double-checking the Solution

The `ispersonal` function correctly returns a trait indicating whether the provided vehicle type is for everyday personal driving. It does so by checking if the vehicle is of type `Car` or `Motorcycle`, which are considered personal vehicles in this context. The function defaults to false for any other subtype of `AbstractVehicle` (e.g., `Bus` and `Truck`).

The implementation uses a conditional statement to check the specific types and returns a boolean accordingly. This approach ensures that new types can be added to the hierarchy without modifying the `ispersonal` function, as long as they are correctly defined as subtypes of `AbstractVehicle`.

The example usage demonstrates that the function works as expected for the provided vehicle types.
